definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to move back and forward/to trade
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to ram (earth)/to compact earth by ramming
to mash/to beat to a pulp

sentences.english: The mochi-making assembly is an annual tradition of the Yamaguchi-gumi.
sentences.chinese: 捣麻糬大会是山口组每年的惯例。

sentences.english: He asked his bean-counter to crunch the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他请求他的统计专家去捣弄数据。

sentences.english: Use muddler to lightly press mint and dissolve sugar.
sentences.chinese: 用捣棍轻轻压碎薄荷，撒上糖。

sentences.english: It discusses how to prolong life of refinery furnace liner with ramming material.
sentences.chinese: 论述了延长精炼电炉捣打料炉衬寿命的问题。

sentences.english: She was pounding it in a mortar with a pestle, to separate the husks.
sentences.chinese: 她把稻米放入臼钵里，用杵捣着，以分离稻壳。

sentences.english: This is the black goblin's fault, I am sure.
sentences.chinese: 他想，“我断定这都是那黑妖精捣的鬼。

sentences.english: Prolonged hand movement. To knock, to pound with pestle .
sentences.chinese: 手持久的动作，敲打也，捣舂也。

sentences.english: His blue eyes were twinkling as he nudged me with his elbow.
sentences.chinese: 他的蓝眼睛狡黠的一眨一眨，用手肘捣了我一下。

sentences.english: Iron young tiger and embroider cloud decided to go to the human nature of this didnt beaten group.
sentences.chinese: 铁彪及绣云决定去捣破这个没人性的集团。

sentences.english: The girl next to me banged my elbow with an indian club.
sentences.chinese: 我旁边那姑娘的体操棒梆的一下捣在了我的肘上。

sentences.english: What drink requires the use of a "bar muddler" in its preparation?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的鸡尾酒在制作过程中需要使用捣杵？

sentences.english: Tom helps her tamp the soil with his squidgy fists.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆帮着用他软湿的拳头把土捣结实。

definition: to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
classifier for hair or grass: tuft/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to pick up (a powder etc) with the fingertips/to scoop up/to collect together/to extract/to gather up/classifier: pinch/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
stone roller/roller and millstone/to grind/to crush/to husk
to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
